thread.title: Fabbri gets tiebreaker in 3rd as Blues beat Oilers, McDavid
thread.title_full: Fabbri gets tiebreaker in 3rd as Blues beat Oilers, McDavid

title: Fabbri gets tiebreaker in 3rd as Blues beat Oilers, McDavid
text:
Updated: 11:08 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 | Posted: 11:08 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 Fabbri gets tiebreaker in 3rd as Blues beat Oilers, McDavid Related View Larger St. Louis Blues' Robby Fabbri, right, scores past Edmonton Oilers goalie Cam Talbot and Ryan Nugent-Hopkins, bottom left, during the third period of an NHL hockey game Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, in St. Louis. The Blues won 3-1. (AP Photo/Jeff Roberson) View Larger St. Louis Blues' Alex Pietrangelo, top right, flips over Edmonton Oilers' Matt Hendricks while chasing after a puck as Blues goalie Brian Elliott, left, watches during the first period of an NHL hockey game Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, in St. Louis. (AP Photo/Jeff Roberson) View Larger St. Louis Blues' Alex Pietrangelo, top right, flips over Edmonton Oilers' Matt Hendricks while chasing after a puck as Blues goalie Brian Elliott, left, watches during the first period of an NHL hockey game Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, in St. Louis. (AP Photo/Jeff Roberson) Edmonton Oilers' Connor McDavid warms up before the start of an NHL hockey game against the St. Louis Blues, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, in St. Louis. (AP Photo/Jeff Roberson) Sponsored Links The Associated Press ST. LOUIS — 
Rookie Robby Fabbri scored the tiebreaking goal midway through the third period to help the St. Louis Blues beat Edmonton 3-1 Thursday night, spoiling Oilers rookie Connor McDavid's NHL debut. 
Vladimir Tarasenko had the tying goal for the Blues near the midpoint of the second period, and Troy Brouwer added an empty-netter with 18 seconds remaining in the third. Brian Elliott finished with 23 saves. 
Ryan Nugent-Hopkins scored in the first period for Edmonton and Cam Talbot had 28 saves. 
McDavid, the No. 1 overall pick in this year's draft, took 22 shifts, played 18:07 and was on the ice for Brouwer's goal. He had two shots on goal, and struggled on faceoffs — winning only three of 13. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WFTV Morning News Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
